articles.description: Apple captured a quarter of China's smartphone market in October as sales of the iPhone 17 series accelerated.

articles.description: iPhone 17 lineup sparks a major rebound for Apple

articles.title: China smartphone market sees 8% growth in October, iPhone 17 leads surge
articles.description: Investing.com -- China’s smartphone market grew 8% year-over-year in October, with Apple Inc (NASDAQ:AAPL) capturing 25% of all sales as the iPhone 17 series continues its strong performance.

articles.title: Apple: As A Shareholder I Am Concerned About Their Ability To Innovate
articles.description: Apple posts record Q4 2025 earnings but faces growth concerns amid limited innovation and AI investment.

articles.title: Apple takes 25% share of China smartphone market in October on iPhone 17 demand
articles.description: Apple last ‌achieved this market share milestone in 2022 when competition in the premium segment was weaker.  China’s overall smartphone sell-through grew 8% year-over-year in October, driven by Apple and domestic manufacturers, data showed.  ⁠All three iPhone 17 ‌variants posted mid-to-high double-digit percentage growth, led by the base variant, Counterpoint said.

articles.title: Apple’s iPhone Sales Surge in China to Take 25% Market Share
articles.description: The figures suggest Apple’s year-on-year upgrades are resonating with consumers and support Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook’s prediction that the company will return to growth in China this quarter.  Each of the successor models, from the 5,999-yuan (about $850) iPhone 17 to the 8,999-yuan 17 Pro Max, outperformed its iPhone 16 precursor in sales by a double-digit percentage, according to Counterpoint.

articles.title: IDC: Apple still has room to grow in the India smartphone market
articles.description: Navkendar Singh, Vice President of IDC India, expects Apple's India sales to grow by another 10% to 15% annually over the next four to five years. He also explains how & why Chinese smartphone brands continue to lead India's smartphone market.

articles.title: Who could succeed Tim Cook as Apple CEO?
articles.description: Apple (AAPL) is reportedly planning for CEO Tim Cook to retire, with the iPhone maker considering company insiders to lead the company. Yahoo Finance Tech Editor Dan Howley outlines two Apple insiders who could step up and assume the chief executive mantle. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

articles.title: Apple refused permission to appeal UK ruling on app store commissions
articles.description: LONDON (Reuters) -Apple was on Thursday refused permission to appeal against a London tribunal ruling that it abused its dominant position by charging ​app developers unfair commissions, though the tech giant said it would pursue ‌an appeal to a higher court.  The Competition Appeal Tribunal (CAT) ruled against Apple last month after a ‌trial, finding Apple had abused its dominant position by shutting out competition in the app distribution market and "charging excessive and unfair prices" as commission.  The decision left Apple – which has faced mounting pressure from regulators in the U.S. and Europe over the fees ⁠it charges developers – ‌facing a potential bill of over 1 billion pounds ($1.3 billion).

articles.title: Apple’s MLS Streaming Shift May Alter Revenue-Share Plans
articles.description: When Apple and MLS announced their 10-year streaming tie-up in 2022, there were two key financial components: a $250 million annual guarantee from Apple, plus the opportunity for MLS to get a share of additional revenue if the new Season Pass subscription product achieved a certain level of success. But starting next season, MLS Season …

articles.description: While Microsoft and Meta burn billions chasing AI dominance, Apple's restraint is suddenly its biggest strength.

articles.title: US jury says Apple must pay Masimo $634 million in smartwatch patent case
articles.description: (Reuters) -A federal jury in California said on Friday that Apple owes medical-monitoring technology company Masimo $634 million for infringing a ​patent covering blood-oxygen reading technology.  The jury agreed with Masimo that the Apple ‌Watch's workout mode and heart rate notification features violated Masimo's patent rights, a Masimo spokesperson confirmed.  An Apple ‌spokesperson said that the company disagrees with the verdict and will appeal.

articles.title: Apple is ramping up succession plans for CEO Tim Cook and may tap this hardware exec to take over, report says
articles.description: John Ternus, Apple's senior VP of hardware engineering, could take control of the company as soon as next year, sources told the Financial Times.

The Competition Appeal Tribunal (CAT) ruled against Apple last month after a ‌trial, finding Apple had abused its dominant position by shutting out competition in the app distribution market and "charging excessive and unfair prices" as commission.  The decision left Apple – which has faced mounting pressure from regulators in the U.S. and Europe over the fees ⁠it charges developers – ‌facing a potential bill of over 1 billion pounds ($1.3 billion).

articles.title: This $1 Billion Trump Loan For Three Mile Island Lifts S&P 500 Nuclear Giant
articles.description: Constellation Energy shares angled higher at Wednesday's stock market open after the Department of Energy announced late Tuesday that the S&P 500 nuclear giant's plans to restart a Three Mile Island reactor is now backed by a $1 billion Trump administration loan.  The Department of Energy loan is expected to cover much of the project's estimated $1.6 billion cost with the first advance expected to make its way to Constellation Energy in Q1 2026.  The nuclear giant first announced it will be firing back up Pennsylvania's Three Mile Island Unit 1 in September 2024 as part of a two-decade long contract with Microsoft to provide power for the tech giant's data centers.

articles.title: IntelePeer Supercharges AI Platform with Microsoft Azure Cosmos DB for Enterprise-Grade Performance
articles.description: DANIA BEACH, Fla., November 19, 2025--IntelePeer, an end-to-end conversational and agentic AI platform provider, today announced it has integrated advanced capabilities of Microsoft Azure Cosmos DB into its conversational and agentic AI platform, giving multi-location healthcare organizations and medical practices enterprise-grade performance and scalability for delivering superior patient experiences.

articles.title: Truist names Pascal Belaud as chief AI & data officer
articles.description: Truist Financial Corporation (NYSE: TFC) today announced that Pascal Belaud will be the company's chief AI & data officer, starting Nov. 24. Belaud, who joins the company from a long tenure at Microsoft, will be responsible for shaping the strategic vision and execution of Truist's AI, data, and advanced automation strategy across the enterprise. He will report to Truist Chief Information Officer Steve Hagerman.

articles.title: AI Weekly: Mega deals and Molière-inspired plays
articles.description: STORY: From multi-billion dollar deals, to plays written with AI -- this is AI Weekly. -- :: AI WeeklyMicrosoft and Nvidia have made a mega deal with Claude-maker Anthropic, featuring tens of billions of dollars of spending.It includes a $30 billion commitment by the AI company to Microsoft's cloud services, Azure. And both Nvidia and Microsoft committing up to $10 billion and $5 billion in Anthropic, respectively. The agreement brings together major players in the AI industry, with Claude being a major rival to ChatGPT.Elon Musk’s artificial-intelligence startup xAI is in advanced talks to raise $15 billion in new equity - at a valuation of $230 billion.That's according to the Wall Street Journal. The new valuation would more than double the amount disclosed in March.The startup has been rapidly scaling its data-center footprint to train more advanced models, as it tries to close the gap with OpenAI’s ChatGPT and Anthropic’s Claude. Bank of America is planning to spend $4 billion more in new technology, including AI, to boost bankers' productivity and drive revenue growth.The bank's chief technology officer said its 18,000 developers have used AI agents for the past year, with significant gains in productivity.The second-biggest U.S. lender sends AI-generated market information to its financial advisers, combined with data on clients' portfolios, so that bankers can better tailor their investment advice.Nvidia's move to use smartphone-style memory chips in its AI servers could cause server-memory prices to double by late 2026.That's according to a report published Wednesday by Counterpoint Research.Electronics supply chains worldwide have been hit by a shortage of legacy memory chips in the last two months.Manufacturers have turned their focus to high-end memory chips suited to semiconductors.Counterpoint says Nvidia's decision to reduce AI server power costs, by changing the kind of memory chip it uses, could create sudden demand that the industry is not prepared for.:: Sorbonne Universite / Theatre Moliere SorbonneAnd, scholars have teamed up with an AI collective in Paris to create a new play written in the style of the famous 17th-century playwright Moliere.Over the last three years, the team has trained the French-developed Mistral AI on Moliere's works, personal library texts, and historical documents to replicate his language and humor.A production called "The Astrologer or the False Omens" is set to debut at the Chateau de Versailles in May 2026.

articles.title: Lumen Launches Defender Advanced Managed Detection and Response for Microsoft Customers
articles.description: DENVER, November 19, 2025--As AI and cloud adoption accelerate, so do the speed and sophistication of cyberattacks. To help organizations keep pace, Lumen Technologies (NYSE: LUMN) today announced the launch of Lumen Defender℠ Advanced Managed Detection and Response (AMDR) with Microsoft Sentinel—a fully managed, cloud-native security solution that merges Lumen’s global network intelligence with Microsoft’s leading security platform.

articles.title: INVENT Appoints Former Microsoft and Red Hat Executive Jim Zimmerman as Chief AI Officer
articles.description: INVENT, the leading platform solving for the integration and data management challenges in wealth management, announced today the appointment of Jim Zimmerman as its Chief AI Officer. Zimmerman joins Invent following a distinguished career at Microsoft and Red Hat, where he helped shape cloud, open-source, and AI strategies that transformed how enterprise developers deploy and manage technology at scale.

articles.title: 2U to Launch Microsoft AI Program for Global Executives on edX
articles.description: 2U, a global leader in education technology, today announced a collaboration with Microsoft to launch CxO Edge: Run your business on AI, a new online executive education program launching first on edX, 2U's global online learning platform, in early 2026. Introduced today at Microsoft's Ignite conference, the program helps business leaders move from AI experimentation to measurable enterprise performance.

articles.title: Informatica Deepens Collaboration with Microsoft to Accelerate Enterprise GenAI with Trusted Data
articles.description: REDWOOD CITY, Calif., November 19, 2025--Informatica, a leader in enterprise AI-powered cloud data management, today announced three strategic innovations with Microsoft. The announcement, at the Microsoft Ignite 2025 conference, showcases the integration of Informatica’s Intelligent Data Management Cloud (IDMC) platform with Microsoft Foundry, Microsoft’s enterprise-grade agentic AI platform.

articles.title: Sepio Becomes Eligible for Microsoft MACC - Unlocks Asset-Level Visibility via Azure Marketplace
articles.description: Sepio, the pioneer in hardware-asset risk management, today announced that it is now eligible under the Microsoft Azure Consumption Commitment (MACC) program via the Azure Marketplace. This enables organizations with existing MACC agreements to apply committed Microsoft Azure spend toward acquiring Sepio's innovative software-based solution, bringing deep visibility and control to IT, IoT, OT and CPS environments.

articles.title: CrashPlan Deepens Collaboration with Microsoft to Strengthen Enterprise Data Resilience
articles.description: MINNEAPOLIS, November 19, 2025--CrashPlan expands Microsoft partnership with M365 archiving, AI-search innovation, and will showcase these advancements at Microsoft Ignite 2025.

articles.title: Kasisto Powers AI for Banking Across the Microsoft Enterprise Ecosystem
articles.description: NEW YORK, November 19, 2025--Kasisto, a leader in banking AI, today announced that its KAIgentic platform is one of the first agentic platforms integrated with Microsoft Agent 365, enabling financial institutions to deploy intelligent, compliant banking AI agents across the Microsoft enterprise ecosystem. The integration allows banks using Microsoft 365 to manage domain specific AI agents that transform customer engagement, elevate employee productivity, and drive operational efficiency within t

articles.description: A prominent technology analyst has slammed Oracle Corp.'s (NYSE:ORCL) high-profile AI strategy, labeling it “bad behavior” and an “irresponsible investment” that relies on speculative demand, unlike the “healthy” and established customer-driven AI ...

articles.title: Google plans $40 billion Texas data center investment amid AI boom
articles.description: The investment, which will be ‌made through 2027, underscores the intensifying competition among AI and cloud service providers to build infrastructure capable of supporting ‌advanced AI models.  OpenAI, Microsoft, Meta Platforms and Amazon are among companies spending billions in new AI-focused data centers.  Google said one of the new data centers will be in Armstrong County, in the Texas Panhandle, and the other two in Haskell County, a stretch ⁠of West Texas near Abilene.

articles.title: Microsoft, facing conservative pressure, disavows religion bias
articles.description: Alliance Defending Freedom, a legal advocacy group involved in the 2022 overturning of  and landmark cases tied to religious-freedom issues, alleged that Microsoft withheld discounts to ADF itself and to certain other nonprofits, such as groups that don’t hire LGBTQ people for religious reasons and pregnancy resource centers that don’t offer abortions.  Investors represented by ADF planned to use the allegations to urge shareholders to ask Microsoft at its annual meeting on Dec. 5 to prepare a report on its discounting practices.

articles.description: AI Turbulence Rattles Silicon Valley, but Wedbush Sees a Breakout Rally Ahead

articles.title: Levi’s picks Microsoft to deploy ‘super-agent’
articles.description: The apparel giant said it will launch a "complex agentic framework" in 2026 that will integrate several sub-agents across IT, HR and operations.

articles.title: Anthropic to spend $30B in compute through Nvidia and Microsoft
articles.description: CNBC's Steve Kovach breaks down the latest news on a new investments from Anthropic, what the spend means for the AI competitive landscape, and more.
